p: Treatment with AS-AT did not inhibit ACE activity whereas standard ACE inhibitor, captopril, inhibited the ACE activity around 53% ( Figure 8(a)). Treatment with AS-AT did not alter the erythrocyte carbonic anhydrase activity whereas typical carbonic anhydrase inhibitor, acetazolamide, inhibited it by 55 ± 5% ( Figure 8(b)). Moreover, AS-AT (3–30 μM) did not change in vitro renal Na+/K+/ATPase activity ( Figure 8(c)).
